Sentencas: Restructuring of Ni in cermet anodes of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) has been studied using both bulk fuel cells and thin foil anodes.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The bulk cells were button cells (23 mm in diameter) with cermet anodes (30-70 mu m thick) made up of nickel and gadolinium-doped ceria (Ni/CGO).
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The cells were operated (under current load) at 700 degrees C in moist H-2 or moist H-2 with low levels of H2S. Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) was used to characterize the microstructure before and after testing.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The thin foil samples (100-150 nm thick) were cermets of nickel and yttria doped zirconia (Ni/YSZ) and these were exposed (without current load) at 700 degrees C to dry H-2, moist H-2 or moist H-2 with H2S (1 ppm).
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and SEM were used to analyze the microstructural changes in these samples.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The anodes from the bulk cells exhibited terracing of Ni grains in all instances, with the extent of terracing increasing with exposure to H2S, and with increasing H2S levels and exposure time.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The thin foil anodes showed much more extensive Ni restructuring leading to agglomeration and faceting of Ni grains.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: This was accompanied by debonding from YSZ, commencing at triple points, where some combination of three Ni/YSZ grains meet.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments

Sentencas: The amount of restructuring increased with increasing H-2 concentration in the gas, and was accelerated by the presence of H2S and/or H2O. Evidence is presented that indicates that terracing may represent the early stages of Ni agglomeration.
Titulo: Structural modifications to nickel cermet anodes in fuel cell environments
